page.title: 13TWO YALDING AUTHORS
page.content: In Yalding live two personalities whose work is of major national importance. Mr Peter Huntingford, MD FRCOG, has recently written "Birth Right, The Parents' Choice", published by the British Broadcasting Corporation to accompany the second showing of the TV series which featured Mr Huntingford. In 1965 the youngest person to hold a professor- ship in obstetrics and gynaecology, Mr Huntingford is deeply interested in groups who are fighting for the rights of mothers-to-be and he has for many years been an adviser to the National Childbirth Trust. Dr Audrey Livingston Booth, whose initiative and work saw the setting up of the Stress Foundation, has recently had published a book on the subject of stress entitled "Stressmanship".
